name: Mercure Albi Bastides

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ideal location on the right bank of the River Tarn with easy walking access to historic city center. Staff were perfect in all aspects of hotel services. Our guest room had all appropriate amenities. Highest recommendation!
reviews.title: Rainy May in Albi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mercure Hotel in Albi, France and had a wonderful dinner. Our table had a view ofthe red-bricked old city and the food complemented the view. The service was just right as were the prices. I would say it was our best dinner in our three weeks in Europe.
reviews.title: Wonderful dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: small rooms, first room without view. door to WC not closable. arrogant staff. Trip advisor is asking for to much text material. We were not satisfied with the room and service. pariking was OK. advice of resto in the neithbourhood was quite good, aberge le viex pont.
reviews.title: bad luch or bad?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here simply as an overnight stop en route from Toulouse airport to the Dordogne. It was an excellent choice. Our riverside view room ( I think a must do choice) was quite unique with beautiful views in two directions over the river, bridges and weir. Quite beautiful.
reviews.title: A bit special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The evening meal deal was excellent, as was the food. The breakfast was expensive at 14 euros but that alone did not detract from a lovely overnight stay. Easy parking and nice staff.
reviews.title: Best in town – but there's not much competition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located across the river from the cathedral, and for rooms facing the river, the setting is top drawer-tres bien! For travelers who are touring and dining out, it's a very good choice because there the little things you need are included a decently sized rooms-not luxurious but you're site-seeing right? I think the renovation of this brick building couldn't provide for larger rooms. Private, gated parking is right out front. Very comfortable sheets and pillows. Intimate restaurants on the same side of the river recommended by the concierge were excellent. We would stay here again without question and consider it a bargain.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Decent hotel with basic thing for accommendation. Room is small and with the things you need. Hotel is a bit old. Free parking space if you bring a car. Walking distance from the city central. Nice restaurant with fast service.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first two nights of a two week visit to France and Spain. The property is well maintained and in a good location. The medieval old town is a 10 minute walk across the river. Dining options are very limited on the hotel side of the river so you may want to eat at the hotel or be prepared for a walk in the dark over the bridge. (Albi feels very safe for walking.) We found the host at the hotel restaurant to be very stuffy and not helpful. We were unable to get a reservation before 8:45 on either night of our stay and he seemed very pleased to tell us this.
reviews.title: Many Pluses, Some Awkward Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is free and accessible. Our room on the fourth floor (there is a good elevator) was quite small but offered nice light and a beautiful, if limited view of the river and medieval town. We had to kneel down and look through the very top of a window to see anything because the top of the window came up only to our waist. Wifi was available but provided only weak sporadic service. The front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating. However on checking in and going to our room we encountered a plumbing problem with the water. Fortunately after several minutes the issue resolved itself and we did not need to change rooms. But before that, the only room change option we were offered was in to an even smaller room next door. The attention extended to us in trying to resolve this problem was professional and involved. They could not have been more concerned or nicer. However the alternative presented was not acceptable.
reviews.title: Five Star location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again and recommend the property to others if can pin down what room you are getting. Ask for a room with normal windows and make sure to book one that is larger than a closet. We were told the hotel was fully booked but it didn't seem that way.
reviews.title: Good Position but have stayed in better Mercures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not the most characterful hotel in a city oozing with character but if you want a convenient and clean place to stay you wont go wrong with this hotel. It's a 10 minute walk across the old bridge and up a fairly steep hill to reach the cathedral and the bishops place (location for the Toulouse Lautrec museum. Rooms are a bit on the bland side in terms of decor but they have excellent soundproofing which is a mist since the hotel is right on top of a very noisy weir. Make sure to get a room facing the river and the city or you could end up with one facing nothing more interesting than a very dull roof of an adjacent building.
reviews.title: Best option in Albi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: It could be better. The hotel looks old and not at an international level. The staff is nice but they can do so much to fix the problems. Of course the view on the old town is fantastic. But keep in mind that if you book one of the most expensive rooms you will have the view but also the noise from the river Tarn.
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would have to say I was a little disappointed in the room, a renovation would be needed, The staff was very helpful, and having breakfast outside was a huge plus. Perhaps our room wasn't the greatest because we were traveling with dogs.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agreeable location - a bit away but nicely placed - and a very fine physical set-up. The only problem is the staff. One gets the impression that they work for a chain and following directions and doing their job as they see it are their main concerns. For example, when we came to the dining room at about 9pm we were met by a rather supercilious gentlemen who suggested that we might have dinner in our room rather than in the (empty) dining room. Time and again there was the impression that things would be better for the staff if we weren't bothering them. A pity overall.
reviews.title: A chain hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped for 1 night and found the room comfortable and well equipped. The view from the window was limited, the bar staff were very friendly. The town and cathedral are well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Good touring hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at this hotel. We had booked a Standard room, but it was tiny and there was no view, so we upgraded to a Superior room with a beautiful view for an additional 20 Euros per night. It was certainly worth it, although it turned out to be a handicapped room with a strange sliding bathroom door. We were very comfortable there for two nights.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Albi is a great place to visit and this hotel has a fabulous location. the staff are friendly and efficient but the hotel has seen better days. The rooms are small compared with other Mercure hotels and the rsetaurant closes on a Friday night!! the day most weekend trippers will arrive. Only gets 6/10 from me.
reviews.title: A little jaded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed good staying.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't speek French and our English skill is poor. So they help us to reconfirm our reservation for the restaurant.
reviews.title: Room with a VIEW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After we checked out the hotel, we can use the hotel parking for sightseeing.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel in Albi

description: 56 rooms in the city centre near the Pont Neuf on the Tarn river banks. In watermill building dated 1770. 500 meters from the Berbie Palace and museums. 800 meters from Ste Cécile Cathedral. Bar, regional restaurant and 3 meeting rooms (30 people).
